articles.title: Marvell (MRVL) Remains in AI Winners Camp as Morgan Stanley Nudges Target Higher

articles.title: AMD Stock Gets Bullish Re-Rating as Export Ban Relief Sparks $800M Upside
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed

The government announced in July that it would review and likely renew AMD's license application for exporting MI308 AI chips to China. The firm expects AMD to recover an estimated $800 million in revenue during the second half of 2025.

articles.title: Zuckerberg Says Superintelligent AI Is ‘Now in Sight'—Here's Meta's Unique Approach
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META) is one of the AI Stocks Making Waves on Wall Street. CEO Mark Zuckerberg believes that the creation of super intelligent artificial intelligence is 'now in sight' and that it will usher in a 'new era of personal empowerment'

articles.title: Pony AI (PONY) Expands Robotaxi Services to Shanghai—Analysts Stay Bullish
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed

articles.title: Tim Cook says Apple ‘must' figure out AI and ‘will make the investment to do it'

articles.summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook has boasted about the potential of AI and the company's approach to developing it in a rare all-hands today. Apple has been slow to roll out some of its AI features and has stumbled with a planned AI-powered upgrade to Siri, which it delayed earlier this year.

articles.title: Bill Gates Sounds the Alarm on AI's Rapid Growth and What It Means for Your Job
articles.author: Rachel Dillin
articles.summary: Bill Gates is worried about the rapid development of artificial intelligence and its potential to replace entire categories of jobs before workers have a chance to adjust to it. He is optimistic that AI's productivity gains can be a net positive if handled properly, but the short-term impact depends on how quickly industries reimagine job training and create new pathways.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs Has Mixed Feelings About CoreWeave (CRWV)—Here's Why

articles.summary: CoreWeave, Inc. (NASDAQ:CRWV) is a cloud platform provider that provides equipment for AI and other computing purposes. articles.title: Can We Build AI Therapy Chatbots That Help Without Harming People?
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Forbes report explores the risks, ethics, and future of AI chatbots. AI mental health chatbots promise affordable and immediate support, but can they be trusted? For more information, go to Forbes.com/psychiatrybot and follow them on Twitter @PsychiatryBot.

articles.title: New vision model from Cohere runs on two GPUs, beats top-tier VLMs on visual tasks
articles.summary: Command A Vision is a visual model specifically targeting enterprise use cases. It's built on Command A's architecture and requires two or fewer GPUs. The vision model also retains the text capabilities of Command A to read words on images and understands at least 23 languages. It outperformed other models with similar visual capabilities in benchmark tests.

articles.title: Artists say AI is taking their identity away
articles.summary: Bret Baier talks about fears over the 'darker side' of artificial intelligence on 'Special Report' with Bret Baier.    iReport.com on Fox News' "Special Report" airs on Sundays at 9 p.m. ET.

articles.title: New vision model from Cohere runs on two GPUs, beats top-tier VLMs on visual tasks

articles.summary: Command A Vision is a visual model built on the back of Canadian AI company Cohere's Command A model. It can read and analyze the most common types of images enterprises need: graphs, charts, diagrams, scanned documents and PDFs. The vision model also retains the text capabilities of Command A to read words on images.

articles.title: Reddit's A.I. Tools Drive 78% Revenue Surge in Best Quarter Since IPO

In the latest quarter ended June, the social media company reported a 78 percent year-over-year revenue increase to $500 million. 93 percent of the revenue came from advertising. Reddit brought in $35 million from A.i. licensing deals, including a partnership with Google.

articles.title: Meta dishes out $250M to lure 24-year-old AI whiz kid: ‘We have reached the climax of ‘Revenge of the Nerds'

articles.title: Merging AI and Quantum Computing: Here's the Stock to Watch

Its shares are trading at 56 times earnings, but the company's position as a semiconductor and AI powerhouse has led to a higher valuation. The Motley Stock Advisor's analyst team has identified what they believe are the 10 best stocks to buy now.

articles.title: How America Can Lead the AI Revolution
articles.author: Stuart Holliday
articles.summary: The Trump administration released its AI Action Plan last week. It outlines more than 90 policy actions to build the infrastructure for data centers and to make U.S. software and chips the standard platform for AI globally. Success will require global leadership and strong industry collaboration. It will also require innovation with international engagement, cross-sector partnerships and a bold diplomatic strategy.

articles.author: Karen Schumacher
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence (AI) is rapidly being integrated into the world, it is incomprehensible the impact it will eventually make on everyone's lives, including the usurpation of the role of faith and God. Even though AI is programmed by technocrats, it's capable of taking data and producing new ideas never thought of before by humans. The peace one has with faith can never be replaced with 'strict logic'.

The United States, China, the European Union, and a few other advanced economies are leading in AI research, patent filings, startup activity, and computational power.

articles.title: ChatGPT is crushing all other AI chatbots, and the numbers prove it

In July, 80.22 percent of U.S. chatbot sessions went to ChatGpt, 9.51 percent to Copilot and 5.61 percent to Perplexity, 2.67 percent to Google Gemini and 1.56 percent to Claude.

articles.summary: Jellyfish analyzed data from more than 400 companies between December 2024 and May 2025 to gauge adoption of agentic AI in software coding. At the start of 2025, just over half of companies were using AI for these tasks. By May, that figure had jumped to 82%. AI-powered code reviews grew even more, from 39% in January to 76% in May. Popular tools for this task include GitHub Copilot Reviewer, Cursor BugBot and CodeRabbit.

Pew Research Center found that between 2023 and 2024, the number of teens in the U.S. who use A.I. for schoolwork increased from 19% to 26%.
